EBB057838F74499D86CF0AC844EDE8E6.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

1699BA0AA71B432381B729EAC0536A36.description: Prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer, expressing appreciation.

8AE2C0FBD1B041408F2309E7EBFF8A1E.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

D1530A43FAD0498BBFFB9EC4AAE036D5.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

315721EF5EF74BB1B40AD610AD07F779.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry

563CF3E83BCD4FEF857878A09C6D006C.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

392174F3671247DBAD2F1A582F69E7F2.description: Document knowledge and awareness of employment standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

3160F55144D94391B6919D29D4DDAA84.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

B86234811A49456F93E46BFC53BF1A67.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

02EA8BCB40C24FE392192E97B947FB89.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

5B98F64511AB462B83F19CF1366C261C.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

925EB62BCA42465DA2B8401DEA569472.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

E6EBC812F4864FEB89AE20B4F4F06C5D.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions

E9DA65461F384AAEB0D2EEA3DBC9B11C.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours? Who is my supervisor? What should I wear? When will I be provided with safety training? What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement? Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance? What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

7640C69A568A47ECA3EB79852A436EE8.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

2DC0C5DEC87C4CCF95F80A6E0E13FC49.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution

588A0A4E702D494086414E0D93A24CC4.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

636147788419418F882D42F724E78591.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations

0D424AFF70E440D89FDD9B868C864D2A.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

C9BB81A17F2A4B5F8025715AF51CDAF2.description: Describe and reflect on the three basic rights that all workers have under Part III – Occupational Health and Safety in The Saskatchewan Employment Act, 2019: the right to know – the hazards at work and how to control them; the right to participate – in finding and controlling workplace hazards; and, the right to refuse – work that you believe is unusually dangerous.

57E321F48226446395E0C0BAE47ABAD6.description: Consider the advantages (e.g., improved efficiency) and disadvantages (e.g., start-up costs) of investing in technology to increase revenue in livestock production.

104D6B571BCC4E4E910F05A3247B2E72.description: Research a specific technology being developed or adapted for livestock in precision agriculture.

CBD8AFB000F34B4A8778456EE7040848.description: Examine the impact technology has on the overall cost of livestock production.

EF6901A6A6BA4179B1027BE6166EAAE0.description: Discuss the use of blockchain as a system to manage livestock records that are completely transparent.

529CD7CA76154BD8B787D0F144C84769.description: Investigate the use of weather stations to maximize pasture health.

8B9D8E5CD5D34866B99521A00DCCD198.description: Explore how robotics can be used to automate specific on a farm tasks (e.g., egg sorting and milking machines).

D8914CBC47E148F892A7216152080172.description: Examine how drones can be used in gathering data and performing tasks (e.g., livestock identification and tracking) in precision agriculture.

A1FA6AFD7AEC4543AA95DF00F980945A.description: Assess the advantages, disadvantages and safety requirements when using self-driving vehicles in livestock operations.

6DC1D8C73D9F4ECEAE81A4669FBAF75F.description: Explore the use of specialized technology in livestock production.

B36384458BD44724A831FF196B4E87BE.description: Precision Agriculture – Specialized Technology for Livestock Production (Optional)

F9D643B0F15548A9931B14004B973E25.description: Investigate the economic considerations of transitioning to organic livestock production (e.g., barn modifications, pasture requirements and cost of organic feed).

83AC1B2F357F45C0B095CFD120B358B9.description: Research how organic farm operations prepare for an inspection.

DABA21DE09FB4A0F8FBFCE6C7F0004F4.description: Explore the traceability of livestock products to prove organic status.

B789DC7C45B94C2BB44DE4895455ADBE.description: Research the breeding requirements of organic livestock.

35C3DBDD0D9344A295E238AE9F40FB0D.description: Compare the required timing of organic feed for specific livestock (e.g., during their entire life or starting well after birth).

EE4598D744AE4917B05DDF7F6AAD09D1.description: Identify the prohibited substances that cannot be included in organic feed.

C691966BA61B430BBC72031315E2F359.description: Investigate the sources and types of organic feed required for specific livestock.

7FB24CEF44DB4DAEAD27F8DF25844A39.description: Explore the management of an organic livestock operation.

22A8E022DCB84496833745F97B6A0C7E.description: Explore the use of milk replacer, replacement mother and proper facilities (e.g., special pens, milk bottles and/or feed and water containers) to care for orphaned offspring.

5C38ED44868544CBB7F42AF20E24245F.description: Describe the basic care of newborn livestock.

A1B717503F004283BA4B0CBE8A01E6B4.description: Discuss the characteristics, treatment and prevention of common metabolic conditions (e.g., ketosis, milk fever and mastitis) associated with reproduction.

60829B7E60914EBC95142664E50D11F0.description: Identify delivery situations that require veterinary care (e.g., breech, lengthy labour and mother in distress).

EBCBDA50C5F441198BF440EAE87C49F2.description: Describe the different methods used to help an animal give birth (e.g., pulling and caesarian-section).

242B6E9578874EE5B70B075D74C1123D.description: Explore the factors to consider regarding management of a pregnant female including gestation period, expected birthing date, health care, labour and post-birthing care.

48B6CA7473D14351AB0901A65D905FF8.description: Investigate care of pregnant and post-birth livestock.

8664D0A0BF104937B86A095FE14A69C7.description: Explore how collected data is analyzed to inform necessary changes to the production operation.

495694E048244C6B82D5860C929D2977.description: Develop a record keeping plan for a particular species of livestock in an operation, that includes: reproduction (e.g., female productivity and male fertility, breeding dates, birthing rates, birth weights and parent/offspring pairings); raising livestock (e.g., farrowing records, weaning weight and rate of gain and age of livestock in different pens); nutrition (e.g., kind of feed, feed rations and days on pasture); animal management (e.g., sick or injured animals and medication records, daily checks); and, financial management (e.g., inventory, markets, customers, prices, sales, shipments and purchases).

B5EDE276CF634968B61FC18250D5E72E.description: Describe how records can be used to communicate between people (e.g., employers and employees, co-workers, veterinarians, feed specialists and end consumers) involved in the farming operation.

FF2591E6981A4C20A5DD701C2A88FB89.description: Livestock Record Keeping – Planning and Analysis (Optional)

0C05D2B4C0C94EBDAED5C63F43870933.description: Investigate the costs (e.g., rate of gain, forage production, taxes and fencing) of grazing cattle.

0B429C9F38FE4C5087F70B7716082A4F.description: Research the management of species at risk that use pastures as their habitat.

AB819994A23D42149426C5A597C528A0.description: Explore the stocking rates for tame and native prairie including animal unit month (AUM) calculations.

C2C8ADBDB626482BB8432546AB039641.description: Research the benefits and environmental impact of various grazing strategies (e.g., intensive, rotational, swath and spring/fall) on tame and native prairie.

CCA220DD23234CF7AC143BFA32627180.description: Describe strategies of using livestock for noxious weed and invasive plant control (e.g., goat and sheep grazing).

134AEA205DB14F21828C6C0DE6E4ADA3.description: Analyze the importance of stocking rates on livestock health and pasture sustainability.

2B449B90E3D3426F87AB820E15D2F7B8.description: Explore effective pasture stocking, weed control and financial management practices.

6A5B3223EFBC41ACB5FB7A3F2F3C61A1.description: Explore how livestock products can be the focus or supplemental income of a farming operation.

9739E2A59B6C4AF2BA7066EB307F7760.description: Identify local, provincial, national and international markets for various products.

96E25DD01CDB42FDB770DAD0D0B868B7.description: Investigate the impact of secondary industries on the economic value of livestock products.

E2F01A5144F44283838337DEEBC861B1.description: Discuss how animal products are used to create secondary industries (e.g., leather in clothing manufacturing, beeswax in candles and gelatin for cheese) in the marketplace.

B881736F253246D085688D108C6B02A2.description: Identify grading requirements for a specific product

CEC7B4289A0C4778A8A9764D6F2A6F73.description: Research the regulations governing the production of a specific animal food product.

60B84C1D3CEA495CA46E2F44D28ABE07.description: Explore the regulations governing livestock products and the impact of livestock products in secondary industries

7EA329BEFE23427581FEBCAE1C88DCF9.description: Discuss the importance of maintaining livestock health history records.

534244C594AA44FE9BAC30605E01B7E1.description: Investigate the economic considerations of using medications (e.g., medication cost versus value of animal).

3D4CE4FCF76C40BAA117F81B1A7515EF.description: Describe the proper way to administer: • intramuscular injections; intravenous injections; subcutaneous injections; intradermal and intramammary injections; and, eye treatments.

334EB2DB601648779147B7F4A8C9BE1A.description: Identify the location on an animal to administer a particular antibiotic or vaccine.

F5E02C6B7E1B4A0493B53AF56BEF092B.description: Explain why different injection sites are used for vaccines and antibiotics.

B0638BAE64CD4466958302C7D4AAB01B.description: Examine treatment options to reduce the risk of antibiotic resistance.

039EA9B5DCF942B89949E357172E9DCF.description: Identify the manufacturer’s specifications for dosage of medications to ensure optimum effectiveness.

F29496763B964648B12BF7FD3B3280C1.description: Analyze the storage, handling and disposal of medications in a drug protocol and medication program for a livestock operation.

5D469E6693344520A993FAD99B8C5485.description: Research Health Canada regulations that prescribe acceptable residue levels of medication in livestock and livestock products.

5DB2CB8A3AD5439BB17EB44A38A9F9C2.description: Discuss the relationship between drug withdrawal time and maximum drug residue limits in the body or products of an animal (e.g., milk, eggs and honey).

E17952919AE144229DFD5BB7D1A08E49.description: Describe the function and use of anaesthetics, antibiotics and vaccines.

42FC405AF735482C9C5F0667FF656CC8.description: Explore the medical treatment of common diseases (e.g., white muscle disease, bovine black leg and foot rot) in livestock.

F1DAA93D59C0412EBB807376AE5AE95B.description: Investigate the use of medication in treating livestock.

ED9092B3EAE147AC99C8BB0C607B17DD.description: Identify the equipment used to remove animal waste from housing facilities and spreading or injecting the waste as fertilizer.

06012DE74BA74BE3B33A2462FC260819.description: Identify the individual mechanical components (e.g., rollers, motors) in feed mills.

2634F5B648AC4C768A8391CEBCE23D40.description: Describe the function of equipment (e.g., incubators, hatchery equipment, egg transfer machines, slaughter equipment) used on a fowl farm and/or egg production facility.

7A3B333EEE0648FF8A0F90498BD54C3A.description: Investigate the tools (e.g., clippers, shears, carding paddles, roving machine) used to shear sheep and turn their fur into yarn.

3602C4E9CAA1470E9E8367F84DDBB1AC.description: Describe the function of equipment (e.g., milking machine, pasteurizers, separators, homogenizers and tanks) used in the milking process in dairy farming.

FDC7DEAEF3094D7C80FF4CA1482D2D84.description: Explore the ban of gestation crates in Canada.

69BE130EE3B24F079E9B663CCB158A50.description: Research the importance of specialized equipment (e.g., piglet heating equipment, ventilation and cooler systems) in a swine production facility

CD2517D3AD814094B77464F31FE82911.description: Describe the function of equipment used in the honey extraction process (e.g., scratcher, de-capping tool, extractor, separator, settling tanks, pumps, melter).

B16758FF4CA543B89614B711D434C0EA.description: Explore the function of specialized equipment used in livestock operations.

B74023685E2D4B0FB2FDD1F2AE5453DC.description: Explore ways to identify, address and prevent nutrition and feeding concerns, such as: inadequate or improper feed rations; consumption of undesirable plant species; physiological response to changes in feed (e.g., colic and founder); feeding during severe weather; feeding plans to allow for time off; digestive diseases and disorders; foreign objects (e.g., use of magnets); and, dehydration.

E72EF1DA075A4C7F8CA878DB66EE76B3.description: Determine the cost of feed (e.g., hay, grain and supplements) for one animal of a specific type of livestock, for one year.

54EDD2F67ACF4B0E87B6574D3DF092A6.description: Develop and use feeding and nutritional records.

0343400EAECC40EC985BDC7C07300591.description: Investigate support programs for managing livestock feeding.

4C11C3B4C9CF4964A9F2B1C3FCAFF67C.description: Prepare a feeding plan for specific livestock including: • rations, properties and quantities; water quality (e.g., mineral content); time of day, frequency and location; time of year; and, types of feeding equipment.

1E85FC6E6783426FA24024975EE6DC8C.description: Analyze the advantages and disadvantages of different types of feeding systems

742324CCF9B848A78AF4AAD96732DEB4.description: Explain the function of parts of the digestive system and the concept of rumination in specific livestock.

FE129AFE2E7248588481886C3FD1EEF7.description: Apply understanding of nutrition to livestock feeding programs.

315EECA642924F83808D40463423ADD4.description: Describe acceptable methods of carcass disposal.

09E74BF001414932812F4F1C27A350DA.description: Explore situations (e.g., infectious disease) in which a veterinarian may be required to perform euthanasia.

8E907ED0794B4562B56C514B976649F7.description: Examine acceptable and unacceptable methods of euthanizing animals.

C4175C925A194B56A48BCDCD2CC5F3DD.description: Evaluate situations (e.g., broken leg, end of life cycle and suffering) in which euthanasia may be necessary.

7DB60EAE26FF462FABFAF900FC9CEF0E.description: Discuss how to protect humans and herds from transmissible diseases.

4292C5F7328444AFB32AF6FE4203CE59.description: Explore common untreatable diseases (e.g., rabies, bovine spongiform encephalopathy [BSE] and avian influenza) that may result in euthanizing an animal.

4DF1E0EC18C5401F9BB4497BE427E3E6.description: Analyze the protocol (e.g., animal is to be relocated, euthanized or marketed) for conditions or diseases for which treatment is unsuccessful using regular efforts.

95945F018E134895A8D21B0105843D43.description: Explore safe and humane methods of euthanizing livestock.

792928ECAB6444FC85AA72436F1F5D26.description: Prepare an effective time management schedule that balances farm time with school, work and recreation and considers seasonal time management differences.

D4E285706F8249B6B55D491508608205.description: Discuss the implications of climate change (e.g., drought, deluge and storms) on the availability of feed and healthy pastures for grazing.

27A6B66AC1724A36B09CE3B01D79F283.description: Explore the finances of a chosen farm operation including human and equipment resources, types of products (e.g., meat, eggs, wool, honey and dairy) outsourcing stages (feedlot connection), accessibility to markets, cost of input and expected revenue.

12A4D00E68A341A39078F3112C2994B0.description: Develop a nutrition program for a chosen species of livestock including sources of feed, prepared rations, feed storage, method of feeding, grazing methods and sources of water.

5AD2772A730042AF9AF456EAE8E8E768.description: Investigate livestock management practices (e.g., percentage as meat processing, crossbreeding, show and aging livestock and introduction of new animals to the herd or operation) including the ability to handle waste (e.g., manure and carcasses) and herd protection measures (e.g., herd dogs, donkeys and structures).

E79E6F070CA1456387465F5EC440F775.description: Analyze the suitability of farm locations for a chosen species of livestock and size of operation.

15AB59A163AC4BB7A8919AA6EA372344.description: Explore the structures (e.g., buildings, fences and corrals) and land (e.g., features including soil types and use of that land) needed for a chosen livestock operation.

C9F1C67497A24E10915679F6300E5A56.description: Determine the annual cycle (e.g., breeding and culling) and production cycle date ranges (e.g., postpartum, conception, mid gestation and late gestation) for the chosen livestock species.

F6413D50C8EF425F83C9A564E5CD001B.description: Explore the provincial regulations and requirements for establishing a livestock operation.

8442DCAA1C2345ECB0DFCC6B03967938.description: Identify one or more livestock species (e.g., cow/calf, dairy, equine, pork, bison, poultry and bees) for a farm operation

ACE76F1F54274B4C81548CF70D85085A.description: Prepare a management plan for a livestock operation of one or more specific species.

D4719259CD754DBA9B34C7C518B9C29C.description: Apply basic repair and maintenance skills to buildings, livestock facilities, vegetation and roads.

3889B1DEA6B0406698CCC5C944DB8D8B.description: Analyze the factors affecting pasture quality, including: biotic (e.g., parasites, disease and predators); environmental conditions; geographic location and slope of the land; grazing management; soil (e.g., structure, texture and pH); water access and quality; and, type of grass and/or legume.

1846B69C270A4B488960BED0144C26C7.description: Explore the regulations and relevant calculations (e.g., animal unit month [AUM]) for determining suitable pasture size for a particular type and quantity of livestock.

315770B54636468C92B3F1D8DC2C8806.description: Identify the facility requirements and regulations for different holding areas to separate animals for various reasons (e.g., breeding, egg laying, incubators, injured or ill animal, maternity pen and weaning).

FBFAE3EDD0704292A36C86D22FC2819D.description: Explore the governing regulations and maintenance of livestock production facilities.

3438F6092C97484E8D23DC7E7628708F.description: Identify current programs specific to Indigenous agriculture.

9B83BE470438473A98680796732B1863.description: Explore the barriers (e.g., Treaty and government policies) that exist for Indigenous farmers that limit their farming operations on reserves.

46B283E7CD39420FA9DE2FD295D9BFE4.description: Explore The Treaty Land Entitlement Framework Agreement and the impact it can have on indigenous agriculture.

74926820D46D462DA58D835B2ECEC21A.description: Discuss Indigenous perspectives on the current and future use of agriculture in communities with an Elder or Knowledge Keeper.

5D44E7088C6E4876A27513814C7EDEDD.description: Research current agricultural practices (e.g., Treaty Land Sharing Network) that honour treaty rights.

FA6916A471E3458D8316941490F79C80.description: Explore programs that facilitate the development of agricultural enterprises among First Nations communities.

744FFFA10F3A494D84BF863A5D343EE9.description: Analyze the opportunities for growth that agriculture provides First Nations communities.

D1C7E07FF29B426191B49FF19531585F.description: Explore agricultural commodities produced in First Nations communities of Saskatchewan.

BEA59AC5CEE54A03896F5D046BF475C3.description: Investigate the current use of agriculture by Indigenous communities in Saskatchewan.

18A08C357FCA4126A49615C3912AE361.description: Examine employers’ duty to accommodate employee requests as outlined in the Canadian Human Rights Code.

7E1A7FFE77C6487D8B354892804F7F11.description: Research employers’ duties and responsibilities to support workplace mental health as outlined in The Saskatchewan Employment Act.

19D7C86DD90D4B79A52E0E8953B5484E.description: Discuss practical ways that employees can contribute to a psychologically healthy and safe workplace.

D3F336666A764C4289FBFD0AB609829F.description: Describe and suggest possible solutions for unavoidable stresses during peak operating times (e.g., harvest time, calving season and weather events) that employers face in providing accommodation requests.

D8CB93C424B049908BECF131F65EEC52.description: Discuss barriers (e.g., lack of awareness of accommodations, lack of confidence in requesting help, where to find supports, social stigma, fear of reprisal and fear of rejection) that employees face in disclosing a mental health problem or illness and/or requesting accommodations

960238BA5E11417AB6C36B622C612F07.description: Explore accommodations (e.g., flexible hours, job sharing and modifications to the work environment and duties) that can be requested by employees of businesses in an agriculture setting (e.g., farming operations, chemical companies and grain elevators) to support mental health during peak operating efficiency.

B7338DB05A54443E890A7D5EFB57D7A3.description: Investigate employer and employee psychological health and safety in the workplace.

BA7C75DCAD384DC4B6B5F620E28EDCD1.description: Psychological Health and Safety – Employer and Employee (Core)

AE7F06AD2A134479923CC6F6CE4E8343.description: Practise the methods used to remove and dispose of chemical residue (e.g., fertilizer and pesticide spray) from application equipment.

7659352001B7465D8130FFE6A2F91638.description: Explore the environmental impacts of unsafe chemical waste disposal, and how that impacts Indigenous communities (e.g., water, animals and traditional medicinal plants).

2F52CC92B87E43E0A2D545B88EB2EBA1.description: Investigate the responsibilities and correct environmental handling, cleanup and waste disposal of cleaners, containers, coolants, filters, fuel and lubricants (e.g., grease and oil) including organizations that specialize in their cleanup

BA750E10D22B4939ADB3A6700C6FD6C6.description: Investigate regulations and responsibilities to safely dispose of leftover chemical and chemical containers.

C214CFEE16E24F1DA5F52587B5DFD0B0.description: Discuss first-aid procedures for exposure to agricultural chemicals (e.g., fertilizer, pesticide, fuel and anhydrous ammonia).

01636C891AF446B4882E0076099224FC.description: Develop procedures for handling mishaps such as chemical spills.

6AABA59B3D8E40038846FC05C01D9FDC.description: Practise the safe storage of chemical products.

0D992DE217BA4BEFA351F45423694504.description: Demonstrate safe handling of chemical products using approved safety gear.

11A13E38BB924EFC86605BDE80F6E90A.description: Explain the uses of agricultural chemicals that would require a Saskatchewan Pesticide Applicator Licence.

402467D25DB248C9953E09887438175F.description: Explore training and certification opportunities (e.g., WHMIS and pesticide applicator licence) on the safe use of agricultural chemicals.

31984F577E794E4CBFE4C6A6AA167944.description: Investigate record keeping strategies for maintaining SDS information.

6426C740408746DCA7638726CE70CB5A.description: Describe the potential heath risks of exposure to chemicals.

C6C13150AEEC4BE6BC0798C9F274EE4A.description: Identify the types of hazardous materials that an agricultural operation might create.

E334F3A597AA4043AEF53D5D166388E6.description: Discuss the purpose and intended use of the mandatory information on a pesticide label as regulated by Health Canada.

D0C490805DF7418F9B49C56929EC02AE.description: Demonstrate the different hazards, identifiers and uses of consumer products, control products, and pesticides.

512FF7A82A7744DBA5945937BB326346.description: Describe the four parts of Workplace Hazardous Materials Information System (WHMIS) (i.e., labels with warning symbols, hazard identification and product classification, Safety Data Sheets (SDS), worker education and worksite specific training).

8E5E27D82E8A42A79ABF0CFBD601C56B.description: Identify important information categories from product labels, Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS) and manufacturer’s chemical information packages such as compatibility, storage requirements, application method, preharvest intervals and withdrawal periods.

D937616340874D51B47A5911FF6BAC6C.description: Demonstrate the importance of, and methods used for, maintenance of a clean and safe workplace.

39AA1B9781FA4526AAB9A773E87E4594.description: Apply proper handling of hazardous materials to prevent injury in the workplace.

3FCB49184F1D45AC80D93E28A2AF8179.description: Develop a basic Farm Safety Plan that includes: why safety is an important part of the agricultural production business; a frequency for inspections of tools and equipment; requirements for reporting incidents to a supervisor; requirements for use and care of Personal Protective Equipment; requirements for minimum training of workers; how hazards will be identified; how hazards will be controlled; and, an emergency response plan.

22467813299F4230A61172AA7C71C0B6.description: Demonstrate the use of common agricultural production PPE according to the manufacturer’s requirements.

7C30E99AB9834BD4B4936E5C752478D3.description: Describe risks associated with buried underground services (e.g., SaskPower, SaskEnergy, SaskTel and oil transmission lines).

4B7DFFFDB1DC4B91BA390A588A94F37E.description: Describe risks associated with above ground powerlines.

82A92E9D5BA64411A9C6F289A67F596A.description: Demonstrate regular tool inspection and tag out procedures for repair of common tools used during agricultural production.

B001D6D5941F43C0AD2E8F66FEBD7180.description: Demonstrate the utilization and maintenance of protective devices on equipment.

EC05C7C33B6C49A593C5D09B944B1736.description: Develop a list of rules for workplace safety including proper personal protective equipment (PPE), sanitation, neat and tidy work area and reporting workplace accidents and safety incidents

906BDA891E074E6683490C79C26B3032.description: Perform basic safety procedures (e.g., storage and maintenance of tools, clean workspace, working at high heights and working around large equipment) as they apply to an agriculture production operation.

6B7C0B918662484B86D88B1BA3BB4E1F.description: Apply principles and techniques for injury prevention to ensure safety in agriculture production.
